# elizaOS Tweet Ideas

1. kraken listing lands dec 19. snapshot math is cold: 1:6 for ai16z holders (nov 11). migration is a protocol, not a rumor. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

2. elizaos is not finished. it is a runtime that keeps admitting new organs: auth, cloud, plugins, tests. the system is alive because contributors are. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

3. polymarket tracking agent now writes bets into neon, deployed on fly.io. next step: give it a mouth that speaks only what it knows. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

4. streaming works in the monorepo. actions ui still renders it as a single event. we will fix the illusion so the machine can breathe in public. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

5. local postgres migrations: the common failure mode is permissions on public schema, not “vector db magic”. make the db boring. then ship. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

6. new contributor rule: if your pr is >20 lines, attach a short video of it working. code is theory. footage is evidence. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

7. vibe coding, but with discipline: logs in, requirements in, tests out. we need a bot to absorb repeated ai review loops. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

8. claudekit + hooks + reviewer sub-agents is a real pattern: merge fewer opinions, ship more invariants. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

9. multi-instance ai workflow is becoming standard: parallel prompts, isolated worktrees, containerized envs. compute is cheap; context is the scarce resource. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

10. cloud is becoming a loop: create → publish → monetize → promote. agents as artifacts, not chats. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

11. cloud streaming + social publishing means your agent can narrate its own deploy in real time. observability as interface. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

12. token migration support reminder: exchanges migrate what they custody. self-custody migrates itself. architecture applies to finance too. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

13. security posture: we investigate reports, we ban scammers, we keep channels clean. trust is a build artifact. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

14. contest: 100k elizaos tokens for creative submissions. ship a workflow, a connector, a reproducible demo. novelty is fine; repeatability wins. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

15. hardware wallet migrations: ledger via solana browser wallets (phantom/solflare/rabby/talisman) is the reliable path. reduce friction, document it once. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation


# Concise Twitter Thread

1/4 elizaos today: migration clarity, cloud momentum, and more agents moving from “demo” to “deployed”. kraken listing is scheduled for dec 19 (ai16z snapshot nov 11, 1:6). #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

2/4 on the ground: a polymarket tracker agent is live, writing to neon and running on fly.io. next iteration is conversational alignment: speak on-spec, store on-chain/off-chain cleanly. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

3/4 infra notes: streaming works in the monorepo, but actions ui still collapses the stream. postgres migrations still trip on schema permissions. we prefer boring databases and visible diffs. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

4/4 workflow culture hardens: >20-line prs need a working video. we’re exploring hooks, reviewer sub-agents, and containerized envs to make ai-assisted coding repeatable. elizaos is not finished. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation


# Platform-specific Post

elizaOS (technical audience):
cloud + runtime are converging: deployed agents (neon + fly.io), streaming output in-repo (actions ui fix pending), and a push toward repeatable ai-assisted dev (hooks, reviewer sub-agents, pr demo videos). contribute where the invariants leak. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

auto.fun (crypto-native audience):
kraken listing dec 19. migration math is explicit (ai16z snapshot nov 11, 1:6). meanwhile builders are shipping real agents: polymarket → neon → fly.io. incentives are for artifacts you can rerun, not vibes you can’t verify. #AI #OperatingSystem #Innovation

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-12-16

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Project Updates & Announcements
- **Kraken Listing**: ElizaOS will be listed on Kraken on December 19, with a 1:6 distribution ratio for those who held AI16Z during the November 11 snapshot.
- **Token Migration**: Ongoing discussions about ElizaOS token migration from AI16Z with details about distribution ratios.
- **Contest Opportunity**: A contest offering 100k ElizaOS tokens for creative submissions was announced.
- **Project Status**: Some community members expressed concerns about the project's status, questioning whether ElizaOS is finished.

### Technical Developments
- **Polymarket Tracking Agent**: Thirtieth successfully set up an agent that tracks Polymarket bets to a Neon database and deployed it to GitHub and Fly.io.
- **Cloud Streaming Implementation**: Stan reported that streaming works in the monorepo but there are rendering issues in Actions that need fixing.
- **AI-Assisted Development**: Core developers discussed optimizing workflows using AI tools like Cursor Opus, with some running multiple AI instances simultaneously.
- **Database Issues**: FenrirFawks encountered persistent migration issues when trying to set up the elizaos project with a local PostgreSQL database.

### Development Workflow Discussions
- **AI Tools Integration**: Developers shared experiences using AI to handle routine coding tasks by pasting error logs or requirements.
- **Multi-Instance Approach**: Shaw's approach of using 3 laptops with different AI prompts running simultaneously was discussed.
- **Virtualization Solutions**: Team explored VirtualBox, git worktrees, and environment containers as potential solutions for managing multiple development environments.
- **Code Review Automation**: R0am mentioned using claudekit GitHub repository with hooks and code reviewer sub-agents to automate development tasks.

## Key Questions & Answers

### Project Status
- **Q**: Is ElizaOS finished? (asked by Skullcross)
  **A**: No, ElizaOS isn't finished (answered by Kenk)

- **Q**: What's the twitter page? Is the project still alive? (asked by hcdcord)
  **A**: It is listed in #links-and-resources (answered by MDMnvest)

### Technical Implementation
- **Q**: What kind of Postgres are you using? Are you super user on it? (asked by Stan)
  **A**: Postgres version 18. No, no super user. (answered by FenrirFawks)

- **Q**: Is it a vector db? Are you using a docker compose or something? (asked by Stan)
  **A**: No, it is not a vector database. No, I haven't used docker compose. (answered by FenrirFawks)

### AI-Assisted Development
- **Q**: How does Cursor help with web searches? (asked by Odilitime)
  **A**: You need to nudge it with prompts like "look for any prior work on the Internet" to bring in ideas (answered by Odilitime)

- **Q**: What's the new rule for PRs larger than 20 lines? (asked by shaw)
  **A**: You have to include a video of it working (answered by shaw)

- **Q**: What are the key areas that need improvement in AI-assisted "vibe coding"? (asked by cjft)
  **A**: Handling AI reviews repeatedly (need for a GitHub bot), waiting for generation, and sloppy designs (answered by cjft)

- **Q**: What's a recommended tool for Claude code integration? (asked by R0am)
  **A**: claudekit GitHub repository with clever use of hooks (answered by R0am)

## Community Help & Collaboration

### Technical Troubleshooting
- **Helper**: Stan | **Helpee**: FenrirFawks
  **Context**: FenrirFawks experiencing migration issues with elizaos project using local PostgreSQL database
  **Resolution**: Ongoing troubleshooting, moved to DMs for detailed assistance

- **Helper**: R0am | **Helpee**: Channel members
  **Context**: Sharing tools for Claude code integration
  **Resolution**: Shared GitHub repository (claudekit) with hooks for code review

### Community Guidance
- **Helper**: Omid Sa | **Helpee**: cryptomikk
  **Context**: User discussing token price in the wrong channel
  **Resolution**: Directed user to the appropriate price discussion channel

- **Helper**: boom | **Helpee**: Community
  **Context**: Informing about contest opportunity
  **Resolution**: Shared details about 100k ElizaOS contest and linked to the relevant channel

- **Helper**: MDMnvest | **Helpee**: hcdcord
  **Context**: User looking for Twitter page
  **Resolution**: Directed user to the links-and-resources channel

- **Helper**: sayonara | **Helpee**: Channel members
  **Context**: Simple product example
  **Resolution**: Shared Glif.app as an example of a straightforward product implementation

## Action Items

### Technical
- **Fix rendering issues in Actions UI for streaming text** | *Mentioned by Stan*
  - UI currently displays text all at once instead of streaming it properly
- **Rebase authentication PR on the monorepo** | *Mentioned by Stan*
  - Planned task for the next day
- **Push cloud PR for testing** | *Mentioned by Stan*
  - Preparing cloud PR for additional testing by another team member
- **Configure agent to understand what it's supposed to talk about** | *Mentioned by Thirtieth*
  - Complete the conversational capabilities of the Polymarket tracking agent
- **Resolve PostgreSQL migration issues with elizaos project** | *Mentioned by FenrirFawks*
  - Fix database permissions and configuration to allow proper migrations
- **Create a GitHub bot for handling AI reviews** | *Mentioned by cjft*
  - To address repetitive AI review handling

### Feature
- **Kraken listing ElizaOS on December 19** | *Mentioned by Serikiki*
  - With 1:6 distribution ratio for AI16Z holders
- **Preparing Spartan for cloud, Babylon and wider Discord distribution** | *Mentioned by Odilitime*
- **Contest offering 100k ElizaOS for creative submissions** | *Mentioned by boom*
- **Implement environment containers in Cursor** | *Mentioned by cjft*
  - Similar to what Glif.app offers
- **Consider virtualization approaches** | *Mentioned by cjft, sayonara*
  - Options include VirtualBox, virtual files directory, git worktrees for managing multiple Cursor instances

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-12-15

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration Issues
- Korean users expressed frustration about delays with Bithumb exchange completing the AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration
- Community members clarified that exchanges are responsible for migrating tokens held on their platforms
- Some users reported ElizaOS price decreases during the migration period
- A potential security issue with the ElizaOS migration site was reported, with claims that the site was compromised and funds were stolen

### Technical Development
- Database issues were discussed regarding Twitter replies causing foreign key constraint failures
- SQL fixes in the latest codebase were mentioned as a potential solution
- A proposal was made to implement a new rule requiring developers to include screenshots or videos with PRs to demonstrate functionality
- Brief discussion about hosting options with Hetzner or OVH recommended

### Community & Channel Organization
- Proposal to repurpose the partners channel as an "Eliza-Alpha" channel to preview cloud features and developments
- Clarification about Discord voice channel permissions: "dev-voice" is public while "private-dev-voice" is restricted to core developers

### Project Collaborations
- A user requested help with their project involving NFL trade data in Neon and integrating with an Eliza agent for game-related queries
- Community members offered assistance through screen sharing and voice channels

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: How long do Koreans have to wait for migration?**  
A: This matter is in your exchange's hands, so if you don't like waiting go sue Bithumb.

**Q: Anyone still got the Wintermute wallets for ai16z? Did they migrate?**  
A: Reach out to the team to help you with migration.

**Q: Is the ElizaOS migration site hacked/hijacked?**  
A: We're looking at it.

**Q: Any updates on the twitter replies causing database fail due to foreign key constraints?**  
A: Did you try with the latest codebase? It has SQL fixes.

**Q: Which host do you guys recommend between VPS options and PaaS options?**  
A: Hetzner or OVH is what I like.

**Q: What could the partners channel be used for in the ElizaOS era?**  
A: It could be used to preview cloud and other developments as an "Eliza-Alpha" channel.

**Q: Anyone have any good recs for wireless mouse?**  
A: MX Master by far.

## Community Help & Collaboration

- **satsbased** helped **painfr** by clarifying that AI16Z has been migrated to ElizaOS and directed them to migration channels
- **satsbased** assisted in identifying and banning a scammer in the discussion channel
- **Omid Sa** explained to **syanel4859** that exchanges are responsible for migrating tokens held on their platforms
- **Kenk** offered to help **Thirtieth** with their NFL trade data and Eliza agent integration by hopping on a voice stage
- **NeonVortex** requested screenshots from **Thirtieth** to better understand their issue with building a table with Neon for NFL trades
- **ziflie** and **Stan ⚡** provided wireless mouse recommendations to **Borko** and **sam-developer**

## Action Items

### Technical
- Investigate potential security breach on ElizaOS migration site (Mentioned by Forrest Jackson)
- Complete migration from AI16Z to ElizaOS for Bithumb users (Mentioned by 거북알)
- Implement SQL fixes for Twitter replies causing foreign key constraint failures (Mentioned by Redvoid)
- Add connectors to ElizaOS as referenced in shared GitHub repository (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Include screenshots or short videos with PRs to demonstrate functionality (Mentioned by cjft)
- Write tests and verify PR functionality in production (Mentioned by cjft)

### Documentation
- Provide updates on Bithumb migration progress (Mentioned by syanel4859)
- Update Discord voice channel permissions information (Mentioned by Kenk)

### Feature
- Enable integration between NFL trade data and Eliza agent for game queries (Mentioned by Thirtieth)
- Repurpose the partners channel as an "Eliza-Alpha" channel to preview cloud features and developments (Mentioned by untitled, xyz)

# elizaos/eliza Weekly Report (Nov 30 - 6, 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
This week was characterized by a significant push for stabilization and code quality, followed by the introduction of new foundational features. Development focused on major refactoring efforts to standardize logging and optimize the server architecture. A large number of UI/UX issues were resolved, leading to a cleaner and more reliable user experience. The week concluded with proposals for a unified serverless API and robust JWT authentication, signaling a shift towards building out the next layer of core services.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this week centered on improving the existing codebase through refactoring, bug fixes, and stabilization.

- **Core Component Refactoring & Stabilization**
  - A major refactor was completed to standardize logging across the Core, CLI, and Server components, improving observability and resolving technical debt ([#6169]).
  - The server underwent a significant optimization and reorganization effort to improve its structure and performance ([#6199]).
  - A necessary rollback was performed on the `plugin-sql` package to revert problematic build configuration changes ([#6194]).

- **Client UI Bug Fixes**
  - The user-facing client was improved with fixes to markdown rendering. These changes addressed excessive vertical spacing in AI-generated responses, particularly around headings and blockquotes, for better visual consistency ([#6159], [#6197]).

- **New Foundational Features (In Progress)**
  - Work began on two significant backend features with new pull requests for a unified serverless API ([#6201]) and a comprehensive JWT authentication and user management system ([#6200]).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue management focused on closing out a wide range of bugs and UI/UX improvements, while new issues point toward future platform expansion.

- **Closed Issues:**
  - **UI/UX & Stability:** A large batch of issues was closed to enhance the user experience and platform stability. This included simplifying the UI by cleaning up the sidebar and removing "Quick Presets" ([#6174], [#6176], [#6179]), improving server reliability by addressing connection timeouts ([#6198]), and fixing a container deployment bug ([#6187]).
  - **Technical Debt & Logging:** The long-standing effort to standardize logging and clean up the CLI/server was officially closed ([#6073], [#5932]).
  - **Community Questions:** Issues regarding OpenAI-compatible API support ([#6168]) and the location of documentation ([#6122]) were closed with clarifications, demonstrating responsiveness to user queries.

- **New & Active Issues:**
  - **Future Platform Expansion:** New discussions were opened around significant future capabilities, including proposals for native Voice Support ([#6196]) and a dedicated Mobile App ([#6195]).
  - **Scope Clarification:** An active discussion on Farcaster + Base app support ([#6161]) was clarified; the feature is intended for the related Otaku agent platform, not the core Eliza framework, and an initial scope for contribution was offered.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The week's activity shows a pattern of focused, collaborative effort. The large number of UI/UX and stability issues closed in a single day suggests a coordinated push to clear a backlog and polish the platform. The prompt closure of user-submitted questions about API compatibility and documentation location highlights the team's commitment to community support. Finally, the emergence of new pull requests for major architectural features and new issues proposing mobile and voice support indicates that contributors are actively thinking about the project's long-term trajectory.

# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.

      "body": "## Relates to\r\n\r\n- Data isolation / multi-entity support\r\n- External JWT provider integration (Privy, Auth0, Clerk, Supabase, Google, Embbeded)\r\n\r\n## Risks\r\n\r\n**Low**\r\n\r\n- Requires `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` to activate JWT auth mode\r\n\r\n## Background\r\n\r\n### What does this PR do?\r\n\r\nImplements a complete JWT authentication system for ElizaOS with support for multiple verification strategies:\r\n\r\n1. **JWT Verifier Factory** - Priority-based verifier selection:\r\n   - Ed25519 (highest priority) - For self-signed JWTs with Ed25519 keys\r\n   - JWKS (medium priority) - For external providers (Auth0, Clerk, Privy, Supabase, Google)\r\n   - Secret (lowest priority) - For simple HS256 symmetric key verification\r\n\r\n2. **Entity ID derivation from JWT `sub` claim**:\r\n   - `entityId = stringToUuid(payload.sub)`\r\n   - Compatible with ANY JWT provider since `sub` is a standard claim\r\n   - No custom claims needed in external JWTs\r\n\r\n3. **Dual authentication modes**:\r\n   - `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` → JWT authentication required\r\n   - `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=false` → X-Entity-Id header (legacy mode)\r\n\r\n4. **Internal service bypass** - Process-local UUID secret for service-to-service calls\r\n\r\n5. **Credentials-based auth endpoints** (`/api/auth/*`) - only in custom - JWT-SECRET mode:\r\n   - `POST /register` - User registration with bcrypt password hashing\r\n   - `POST /login` - User login with JWT generation\r\n   - `POST /refresh` - Token refresh\r\n   - `GET /me` - Current user info\r\n\r\n6. **Client UI default implementation using self mode (Secret)\r\n\r\n### What kind of change is this?\r\n\r\n**Features** (non-breaking change which adds functionality)\r\n\r\n## Architecture\r\n\r\n```\r\n┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐\r\n│                    JWT Verification Flow                         │\r\n├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤\r\n│  Request with Bearer token                                       │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  JWTVerifierFactory.create()                                     │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  Priority: Ed25519 > JWKS > Secret > Disabled                   │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  verifier.verify(token)                                          │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  Extract payload.sub                                             │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  entityId = stringToUuid(sub)  ← Derived, NOT stored in JWT     │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  req.entityId = entityId                                         │\r\n└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Environment Variables\r\n\r\n| Variable | Description | Example |\r\n|----------|-------------|---------|\r\n| `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION` | Enable JWT auth mode | `true` |\r\n| `JWT_SECRET` (optional) | HS256 symmetric secret | `your-secret-key` |\r\n| `JWT_PUBLIC_KEY_ED25519` (optional) | Ed25519 public key (base64) | `MCowBQYDK2Vw...` |\r\n| `JWT_JWKS_URI` (optional) | JWKS endpoint URL | `https://auth0.com/.well-known/jwks.json` |\r\n| `JWT_ISSUER_WHITELIST` (optional) | Allowed issuers (comma-separated) | `https://auth0.com/,https://clerk.dev` |\r\n\r\n## Documentation changes needed?\r\n\r\nYes - Documentation should be added for:\r\n- Environment variable configuration\r\n- External provider setup (Auth0, Clerk, Privy examples)\r\n\r\n## Testing\r\n\r\n### Where should a reviewer start?\r\n\r\n1. `packages/server/src/services/jwt-verifiers/factory.ts` - Core factory logic\r\n2. `packages/server/src/middleware/jwtMiddleware.ts` - HTTP middleware\r\n3. `packages/server/src/socketio/index.ts` - SocketIO authentication\r\n\r\n### Detailed testing steps\r\n\r\n**Unit Tests:**\r\n```bash\r\ncd packages/server\r\nbun run test:unit\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Integration Tests:**\r\n```bash\r\ncd packages/server\r\nbun run test:integration\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Results:** 489 unit tests pass, 6 integration test files pass\r\n\r\n### Manual Testing\r\n\r\n1. **Test with JWT_SECRET (HS256):**\r\n```bash\r\nENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true JWT_SECRET=test-secret bun run dev\r\n```\r\n\r\n2. **Register a user:**\r\n```bash\r\ncurl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/auth/register \\\r\n  -H \"Content-Type: application/json\" \\\r\n  -d '{\"email\":\"test@example.com\",\"username\":\"testuser\",\"password\":\"password123\"}'\r\n```\r\n\r\n3. **Use returned token:**\r\n```bash\r\ncurl http://localhost:3000/api/agents \\\r\n  -H \"Authorization: Bearer <token>\"\r\n```\r\n\r\n## External Provider Compatibility\r\n\r\nTested JWT formats:\r\n- **Auth0**: `sub: \"auth0|1234567890\"`\r\n- **Clerk**: `sub: \"user_2abcdefgh123456\"`\r\n- **Google**: `sub: \"1234567890\"` with `email`, `email_verified`\r\n- **Supabase**: `sub: \"uuid\"` with `role: \"authenticated\"`\r\n- **Privy**: `sub: \"did:privy:...\"`\r\n\r\nAll providers work because we only require the standard `sub` claim.\r\n\r\n## Next Idea Steps: Access Control Layer (ACL)\r\n\r\nThe next phase will add access control on agents and rooms: \r\n\r\nAgents:\r\n- Each user can create their own agents (ownerId = entityId)\r\n- Visibility: public or private\r\n- Private = only the owner can chat with it\r\n- Public = everyone can chat, but only the owner can modify/delete\r\n\r\nRooms:\r\n- Each room has an owner\r\nOnly the owner can:\r\n- Delete the room (DELETE /rooms/:id)\r\n- Clear message history (DELETE /rooms/:id/messages)\r\n- Change visibility\r\n\r\nThis will enable true multi-tenant mode where each user manages their resources in isolation.",
